content:
The "Japanese Sweets Class" at Cooking Sun sounds like a great choice! I'm sure you'll have a wonderful time learning how to make traditional Japanese sweets like mochi and manju from scratch.

As for matcha-flavored sweets, I'm happy to report that matcha is a very popular ingredient in Japanese sweets, and it's highly likely that you'll learn how to incorporate it into your desserts during the class. Matcha is a staple ingredient in Japanese cuisine, and many traditional sweets and desserts feature matcha as a key flavor component.

In fact, matcha is often paired with traditional Japanese sweets like mochi and manju to create unique and delicious flavor combinations. You might learn how to make matcha-flavored mochi, matcha-filled manju, or even matcha-green tea ice cream sandwiches using mochi wafers!

During the class, be sure to ask your instructor about incorporating matcha into your sweets, and I'm sure they'll be happy to share their expertise and tips on how to work with this popular ingredient. Who knows, you might even discover new favorite flavor combinations!

Remember to also ask about any specific dietary restrictions or preferences, such as vegan or gluten-free options, as some Japanese sweets may contain ingredients that aren't suitable for everyone.

Have fun in your class, and I hope you enjoy learning about traditional Japanese sweets and incorporating matcha into your desserts!
